bug.author: alexanderzimmerman
bug.summary: All Pull Request Docs Checks fail
bug.description:
All open Pull Requests have a failing check related to Sphinx documentation, e.g. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cgre-aachen/gempy/pull/308/checks?check_run_id=473026979>this</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cgre-aachen/gempy/pull/294/checks?check_run_id=479273309>this</denchmark-link> . To Reproduce Make a PR or just look at the Pull Request Docs Check / docs (pull_request) in any open PR.
Particularly with PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cgre-aachen/gempy/pull/294>#294</denchmark-link> , I would not expect any changes to how documentation is handled, yet <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cgre-aachen/gempy/pull/294/checks?check_run_id=479273309>the check fails with a configuration error</denchmark-link> .
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9367569/75666944-056b4080-5c77-11ea-8902-ee9432121a44.png></denchmark-link>
Desktop (please complete the following information): The remote build system used for all PR's
I think <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Leguark>@Leguark</denchmark-link> mentioned that some new checks were added for the GemPy retreat, so maybe this is related to a check we didn't have before.

comments.comment: Yes, this was an action that I activated for 1 hour because apparently you cannot have actions that are not active. All the new commits do not go through that check
